alert.note: Alert for Coal (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 2:07PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Coal and central Atoka Counties through 300 PM CDT... At 207 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Atoka, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Atoka, Stringtown, Tushka, Daisy, Atoka Reservoir, McGee Creek Lake and Redden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
